About to join @AliVelshi live on @MSNBC to talk about this morning’s @SenateFinance hearing on the high cost of prescription drugs. Tune in!

The Republican tax bill gave Big Pharma a huge tax cut and the seven CEOs who are testifying today made over $100 million in compensation in 2017. Can someone explain why they aren’t bringing down drug prices?
It’s pretty clear. Big Pharma charges more because it can. People in Michigan deserve better and they should be able to afford their medicine here at home. pic.twitter.com/Xw0T5ZPJSr
I just asked the AbbVie CEO in @SenateFinance: why don’t you offer the same low price for Americans? He couldn’t answer but listen for yourself here. pic.twitter.com/mD1rasFGIl

Humira is the world’s best-selling drug. It treats arthritis, Crohn’s disease, and ulcerative colitis. AbbVie Pharmaceuticals, which makes Humira, is offering up to 80% discounts to people in Europe to buy Humira.

American taxpayers have contributed more than $200 billion for Big Pharma to develop new medication. What do we get in return? The highest drug prices in the world. As I said just now in @SenateFinance, that’s outrageous. pic.twitter.com/NwnsiWOhu9
